page.title: 12QUARRYING
page.content: The quarry covers approx. 800 acres. It is owned and used by Rugby Portland Cement PLC requiring 58 workers. Excavaters are used to extract the chalk which is then slurried (water is added). The chalk is then pumped 57 miles along an underground pipeline to Rugby, Warwickshire, where it is used in the production of cement. The quarry quarries 6000 to 7000 tonnes of chalk a day. The company, quarry 600 feet to make the site economical. The workers live locally e.g. Dunstable, Houghton Regis, Kensworth, Tottenhoe and Eaton Bray. The present manager predicts that the quarry will keep producing chalk well into the year 2035.
